title: A Splendid View During a Flood

  physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. A single village can be seen in the background of the photograph. Some clothes are being hung outside and a pair of windows are visible. The foreground of the photograph shows the reflection of the images of the background on a body of water. A ripple effect can also be seen on the water. There are also trees and leaves close by the village.

  subject_terms_1: residential structures floods (natural events) dwellings landscapes (representations)

  subject_terms_2: Dwellings Floods Landscapes Singapore Black-and-white photography Street photography

  subject_terms_3: Potong Pasir Artistic photography

  sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows a one of the massive floods that took place in Potong Pasir in the 1970s. Though captured in a dreamy manner
 it reveals a frequent occurrence that people in Singapore faced during those years.
